title: And the Award for Most Awkward Presentation Goes to the Game of Thrones Cast
text:
Jesus and her disciples. Photo: Kevin Winter/Getty Images

No Emmys host? No problem! Let’s just invite ten cast members from Game of Thrones to present Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Limited Series. But only ten … from a show … that notably has 8 million stars. Sophie Turner, Alfie Allen, Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Gwendoline Christie, Emilia Clarke, Peter Dinklage, Lena Headey, Kit Harrington, Maisie Williams, and Carice van Houten meandered onstage after an “In Memoriam” for the show that dominated the Emmys for years. Is this a consolation prize because they’re going to give Outstanding Drama to Killing Eve? Probably not. But at least if they win, we’ll get to see the entire cast of Game of Thrones onstage and not just catch a glimpse of Isaac Hempstead Wright (the literal king we spent eight seasons waiting to crown) from his seat in the audience. One by one, the GOT cast collectively presented one award to Patricia Arquette for her work in The Act. The internet is absolutely being petty about the weird presentation, partly because we all remember the Game of Thrones final season, and partly because Bran has rights!

Bran is the actual winner of the Game of Thrones and they literally did not put him on the stage???? — Kate Halliwell (@katehalliwell) September 23, 2019

Okay credit where it's due, saying "television has never been this damn good" before cutting to a shot of the final Game of Thrones season is a solid joke — Caroline Darya Framke (@carolineframke) September 23, 2019

1) why didn’t they let bran stand on stage?

2) why do they all look like someone is forcing them to do this at gunpoint — rachel syme (@rachsyme) September 23, 2019

did my ears deceive me or did i just hear game of thrones has won 57 emmys



and none have been for lena headey pic.twitter.com/aFP1h6sffh — no (@miskeencore) September 23, 2019

This Game of Thrones moment is weird lmao — Ira thee Third (@ira) September 23, 2019
description: The ‘Game of Thrones’ cast was tasked with presenting an award at the 2019 Emmys, but they were missing quite a few stars.
